intro: Anotis calycina, commonly known as the red-flowered anotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its bright red petals are surrounded by yellow ray florets, creating a striking visual display. Anotis calycina is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
